title: Web-Based Science Learning Motivation Enhancement Course

context.prior_knowledge: Science fundamentals and job-related core concept understanding
context.additional_context: A science learning motivation enhancement program conducted in smartphone-centric limited technology environments. Learning outcomes measured through project-based assessments, emphasizing self-directed inquiry using web-based learning tools (Web-LE).

learning_goals: Learners enhance learning motivation by more than 20% through scientific inquiry activities in web-based learning environments

During the 2-week mid-term phase, learners complete two weekly challenging tasks (e.g., algorithm problem-solving) and three interactive activities (pair programming, code review sessions), while documenting goal achievement (≥80%) and improvement plans in weekly learning journals

Learners design one prototype solving real business problems (e.g., energy efficiency improvement, user behavior prediction) by applying scientific concepts (physics laws, data analysis) and present a creative solution meeting ≥4 of 5 peer-review/technical verification checklist items

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
